cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: drifting northwest to north-northwest and expected to accelerate toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Bay, Texas

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under a Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass; Storm Surge Watch – Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time (warnings expected Thursday)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island, including Calhoun County and Matagorda Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (and possibly hurricane-force gusts) are possible by Friday afternoon through Saturday, with a 55% cumulative chance for 34-kt winds and a 20% chance for 50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge forecast calls for 4–6 ft of inundation along the stretch that includes Calhoun County if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches of rain with isolated totals near 20 inches are possible along the central Texas coast, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and potential river/stream flooding may hamper port and landside transport operations.
